1.SceneDescription:
Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Chandler, Joey, Ross and Ben are
there.  Ben is sitting in his little rocking seat.

lines.Line:
Who da wenny-Benny boy? You the Wenny-wenny-Benny-Benny boy, yes. (Ben
starts crying.) Don't cry. Don't cry. (To Ross) Why is he still crying
Let me hold him for a sec. There. (Ben stops crying) Huh? There we are
Don't be silly. Ben loves you. He's just being Mr. Crankypants
You know, I once dated a Miss Crankypants. Lovely girl, kinda moody
There we go. All better. (gives Ben back to Monica
There we go. All better. (gives Ben back to Monica
There's my little boy. (Ben starts crying again

Can I uh see something? (Takes Ben. When he puts him close to Monica,
Ben cries. When he moves Ben away, he stops crying. He does that a couple times.
He hates me. My nephew hates me
What if my own baby hates me? Huh? What am I gonna do then

Monica, will you stop? This is nuts. Do you know how long it's gonna
be before you actually have to deal with this problem? I mean, you don't even have a
boyfriend yet. (Monica glares at him.) Joey, she does not look fat

2.SceneDescription:
Central Perk, Rachel is doing some cleaning as Phoebe sits on the couch with
her guitar.

lines.Line:
Hey Rach, wanna hear the new song I'm thinkin' of singing this
afternoon? I wrote it this morning in the shower

(singing) <em>I'm in the shower and I'm writing a song. Stop me if
you've heard it. My skin is soapy, and my hair is wet, and Tegrin spelled backward is
Nirget.</em
Uh, Rachel, sweetheart, could I see ya for a minute

F.Y.I.. I've decided to pay a professional musician to play in here on
Sunday afternoons. Her name is Stephanie... something. She's supposed to be very good

Rachel, it's not that your friend is bad, it's that she's so bad, she
makes me want to put my finger through my eye into my brain and swirl it around

Ok, ok, so you're not a fan, but I mean, come on, you cannot do this to
her
Oh, no no no no. Oh no no no no. I have to do this to her

(singing) <em>Lather, rinse, repeat, and lather, rinse, repeat, and
lather, rinse, repeat...as needed.</em

3.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Rachel has just broken the news to Phoebe.

lines.Line:
But, but this is my gig. This is where I play. My, my name is written
out there in chalk. You know, you can't just erase chalk

And he's going to be paying this woman? Why doesn't he just give her
like a throne, and a crown, and like a, you know, gold stick with a ball on top

Terry is a jerk, ok? That's why we're always saying "Terry's a
jerk!" That's where that came from
Yeah, ok. You probably did everything you could.
Yeah, ok. You probably did everything you could.

Ok, you know what, lemme, let me just see what else I can do. (She goes
over to Terry.) All right, look, look. Why don't you just let her go on after Stephanie
whatever-her-name-is. I mean, you won't even be here. You don't pay her. It's not gonna
cost you anything
Come on, Terry, I'll even clean the cappuccino machine
You don't clean the cappuccino machine
You don't clean the cappuccino machine

Of course I clean it. I mean, I,I will cleeeean it. I mean, I will
cleeeean it
Oh, all right, fine, fine, fine
Oh, all right, fine, fine, fine
Yeah. Who's workin' for you babe
Oh! Oh my god. This is so exciting. How much am I gonna get
Well you said that he's paying the people who are playing

Oh, no, no no. I meant that he's gonna be paying that other woman beause
she's a professional
Well, I'm not gonna be the only one who's not getting paid

No, huh uh, I'm sorry, no. No, I'm not some like sloppy second, charity
band. You know what, there are thousands of places in this city where people would be
happy to pay to hear me play.

lines.Character: [Time Lapse, Phoebe is on the sidewalk in front of Central Perk singing
lines.Line: Time Lapse, Phoebe is on the sidewalk in front of Central Perk singing.
(singing, angrily) When I play, I play for me, I don't need your charity. (Someone puts a coin in her guitar case) Thank you! La la la la la la la...

lines.Line:
That's a good plan, Joe. Next time we wanna pick up women, we should
just go to the park and make out. Taxi, taxi
Hey, hey, look at that talent. (Motions to two girls waiting for the bus.
(to taxi driver) Just practicing. You're good. Carry on

lines.Character: (Chandler and Joey run to get on the bus
lines.Line: Chandler and Joey run to get on the bus.

lines.Character: (Chandler and Joey run to get on the bus
lines.Line: Chandler and Joey run to get on the bus.
Ok, but can you tell him that, because he thinks he's too pink
/strong> So what are you guys out doing today

Oh we're not out. No, no. We're just uh, two heterosexual guys, hanging
with the son of our other heterosexual friend, doin' the usual straight guy stuff
Get outta here. This is our stop too
/strong> You guys live around here too
Oh, yeah, yeah, sure. We live in the building by the uh sidewalk

Hey, look, since we're neighbors and all, what do you say we uh, get
together for a drink
They all get off the bus.
They all get off the bus.
They all get off the bus.
/strong> So uh, you wanna go to Marquel's
Oh, sure, they love us over there

5.SceneDescription: Outside Central Perk, Phoebe is still singing.

lines.Line: (singing) ... with the double double double-jointed boy. (A woman carrying a guitar case walks up.) Hey. So um, are you the professional guitar player

Right. My name was on there (The chalk sign out front), but now it just
says "carrot cake". So, um, so um, how many chords do you know
Oh yeah, so you know D
Oh yeah, so you know D
Ok, do you know A minor
Ok, do you know A minor
Ok, do you know how to go from D to A minor
Ok. Um, so does your guitar have a strap
Oh. Mine does. (singing) Stephanie knows all the chords. (makes a face

6.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Rachel is introducing Stephanie.

lines.Line: Ok, everybody, let's give a uh nice warm Central Perk welcome to..
(outside singing angrily) Terry's a jerk, and he won't let me work, and I hate Central Perk
Thank you. I'd like to start with a song that I wrote for the first man I ever loved. (singing) Zachary

7.SceneDescription:
Central Perk, Rachel is standing by the door and looking at Phoebe counting her
money as Stephanie is singing.

lines.Line: Here. I thought you might be cold. (Hands her a cup of coffee.
Whoa, look at you, you did pretty well

Eight dollars and 27 cents. But not really, 'cause I put in the first
two, just to, you know, get the ball rolling, and to make myself feel better

No. This whole like playing-for-money thing is so not good for me. You
know, I don't know, when I sang "Su-Su-Suicide," I got a dollar seventy-five.
But then, "Smelly Cat," I got 25 cents and a condom. So you know, now I just
feel really bad for Smelly Cat

Well, you know, honey, I don't think everybody gets Smelly Cat. You
know, I mean, if all you've ever actually had are healthy pets, then, whoosh! (Waves her
hand over her head.

It's not even that. I used to do my songs because it made me happy, but
now it's like, it's just all about the money

Well, people missed you in there. And in fact, there was actually a
request for "Smelly Cat.

Well, from me. And I know it's not your big money song, but it's my
favorite

lines.Character: (A kid runs up, who looks like, or will look a lot like Phoebe's brother
lines.Line: A kid runs up, who looks like, or will look a lot like Phoebe's brother.

/strong> Hi. Uh, did I accidentally drop a condom in your case? It's kind
of an emergency
/strong> Thanks a lot. Hey Christine, I got it

lines.Line: (singing) Smelly cat, smelly cat, what are they feeding you
No, no, no. I'm sorry. It's "smelly cat, smel-ly cat.

Yeah, much better. And you know what, don't feel bad, because it's a
hard song

Ok, there is no top. That's the beauty of Smelly Cat. Um, why don't you
just follow me
/strong> Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, what are they feeding you? Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, it's not your fault
